hymn.title: Laboring on the good land, laboring in the morning
hymn.category: Experience of Christ—As the Good Land
hymn.chords: | C - - - | F - - - | C - Am - | D7 - G - | C - C7 - | F - Dm - | C/G - Am - | Dm G7 C - | C - C7 - | F - C - | C - Am - | D7 - G - | C - C7/E - | F - C/E - | C - Am - | Dm G7 C - |

layout.singingstanza: La -- boring on the good land, la -- boring in the morn -- ing, La -- boring through the noon -- time to the ear -- ly eve, La -- boring for a har -- vest, reap -- ing all the pro -- duce, Com -- ing to the meet -- ing, bring -- ing in the sheaves. Bring -- ing in the sheaves, bring -- ing in the sheaves, Here we are re -- joic -- ing, bring -- ing in the sheaves! Bring -- ing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves, Here we are re -- joic -- ing, bring -- ing in the sheaves!

lyrics.stanza: Laboring on the good land, laboring in the morning, Laboring through the noontime to the early eve, Laboring for a harvest, reaping all the produce, Coming to the meeting, bringing in the sheaves.
Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves, Here we are rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves! Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves, Here we are rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves!
Reaping wheat and barley, death and resurrection, Though the loss sustained our old man often grieves; But in life abundant, life in resurrection, Coming to the meeting, bringing in the sheaves.
Grain and wine and oil—bringing in the surplus Of the wheat and barley, vine and olive trees: Wine to cause rejoicing, oil to give anointing, Bringing in the top tenth, bringing in the sheaves.
